alert.note: Alert for Elbert (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 14 at 4:09PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Elbert County through 445 PM EDT... At 408 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 6 miles west of Elberton, or 5 miles southeast of Bowman, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Elberton, Bowman, Nancy Hart State Park, Middleton, Russell State Park, Lake Russell, Dewy Rose, Rock Branch, Fortsonia and Sweet City. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
